info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 10 at 10:33PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF SOUTHERN WAYNE... LUZERNE...LACKAWANNA...AND PIKE COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. This band of heavy snow is producing snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1033 PM EST, a band of heavy snow was along a line extending from near Greeley to 6 miles west of Edwardsville and moving southeast at 25 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Scranton, Wilkes-Barre, Hazleton, Muhlenberg, Kingston, Nanticoke, Plains, Bushkill, Pittston and Plymouth. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 80 between 256 and 273. Pennsylvania Interstate 81 between 143 and 180. Interstate 84 between 4 and 46. Interstate 380 between 20 and 24. Interstate 476 between 105 and 115. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
